name: Black Table Canyon
description:
Introduction

There is nothing of interest to a canyoneer above the granite layer. The recommended route is to park on the highway below Maidenwater Springs and hike up the wash to the springs. About 5-10 minutes after the springs head up a rock filled gulley on the right and make your way around to the top of the obvious granite band. This way you see all the best of the canyon and avoid an unnecessary shuttle.

Approach

Descent

Two easy downclimbs then one rappel. Many natural anchor possibilities. Most are CEM or Fiddlesticking.

Exit

From the bottom of the rappel stay in the wash to the highway, about 30 minutes.

Red tape

Beta sites
